title: Improve Semantic Memory Retrieval UX (EXTERNAL)
description:
**EXTERNAL DEPENDENCY** - This is in the `semantic-memory` package, not our repo.

**Repo:** `/Users/joel/Code/joelhooks/semantic-memory`

## Problem
The `semantic-memory_find` MCP tool returns truncated previews (~60 chars) which forces painful workarounds to get full content.

## Current Flow (painful)
```
semantic-memory_find("auth architecture") 
→ "5d2404b8-363" with "...Creators with multiple sites MUST..."  (TRUNCATED)

# Then have to:
bun run src/cli.ts list --json | grep "5d2404b8"  # find full ID
bun run src/cli.ts get "5d2404b8-3635-42a2-bd63-ae623aba2a62"  # get content
```

## Desired Flow
```
semantic-memory_find("auth architecture", expand=true)
→ Full content for top N results, not truncated
```

## Implementation Options
1. Add `--expand` flag to find command
2. Add `--full` output mode
3. Return full UUID always (not truncated `xxx-yyy` format)
4. Batch get endpoint: `get-many <id1> <id2> ...`

## Files to Modify (in semantic-memory repo)
- `src/cli.ts` - Add flags
- `src/services/Database.ts` - Query changes
- MCP server - Expose new options

## Acceptance Criteria
1. `semantic-memory find "query" --expand` returns full content
2. Full UUIDs returned (not truncated)
3. MCP tool gets `expand: boolean` parameter
4. Backward compatible

title: Consolidate external tools into plugin: semantic-memory, CASS, UBS
description:
## Revised Scope: Semantic Memory Only

> *"Making a system simpler does not necessarily mean reducing its functionality; it can also mean removing accidental complexity."*
> — Martin Kleppmann, *Designing Data-Intensive Applications*

Consolidate **semantic-memory** into swarm-mail. CASS and UBS deferred to icebox.

### What We're Removing (Accidental Complexity)
- Separate MCP server process
- Separate PGLite instance (duplicate memory usage)
- Separate config/setup
- Cross-process communication overhead

### What We're Adding (Essential Complexity)
- Memory tables in swarm-mail schema
- Ollama integration for embeddings
- Migration path for existing memories
- Unified search API

### Out of Scope (Filed Separately)
- CASS consolidation → icebox
- UBS consolidation → icebox

### Success Criteria
1. `semantic-memory_*` tools work without separate MCP server
2. Existing memories migrated to swarm-mail PGLite
3. Single PGLite instance for hive + agent-mail + memories
4. Ollama integration for embeddings (optional, graceful fallback)
5. `bun add opencode-swarm-plugin` includes memory functionality

title: [ICEBOX] Consolidate CASS session search into plugin
description:
## Deferred from mjbqs7xge52

Consolidate CASS (coding_agent_session_search) into the plugin.

### Complexity Assessment
- **Language:** Rust → would need TS rewrite or binary bundling
- **Scope:** Indexes 10+ agent session formats
- **Maintenance:** Actively developed upstream by @Dicklesworthstone

### If We Do This Later
- Option A: Bundle the Rust binary (platform-specific builds)
- Option B: Rewrite indexer in TypeScript (significant effort)
- Option C: Lite version - only index OpenCode sessions

### Why Deferred
Build-vs-buy tradeoff unfavorable. The install friction (one CLI) is less than the maintenance burden of forking an actively-developed Rust project.

### References
- Upstream: https://github.com/Dicklesworthstone/coding_agent_session_search
- Parent discussion: mjbqs7xge52

title: [ICEBOX] Consolidate UBS bug scanner into plugin
description:
## Deferred from mjbqs7xge52

Consolidate UBS (ultimate_bug_scanner) into the plugin.

### Complexity Assessment
- **Language:** Python + ast-grep
- **Scope:** 1000+ bug pattern rules across 8+ languages
- **Maintenance:** Actively developed upstream by @Dicklesworthstone

### If We Do This Later
- Bundle ast-grep rules as data files
- Direct rule execution without Python
- Need to track upstream rule updates

### Why Deferred
The 1000+ rules are actively maintained upstream. Forking means we own that maintenance. Current integration (shell out to `ubs`) works fine.

### References
- Upstream: https://github.com/Dicklesworthstone/ultimate_bug_scanner
- Parent discussion: mjbqs7xge52

title: Consolidate semantic-memory into swarm-mail
description:
## Semantic Memory Consolidation

> *"Making a system simpler does not necessarily mean reducing its functionality; it can also mean removing accidental complexity."*
> — Martin Kleppmann, *Designing Data-Intensive Applications*

Embed semantic-memory functionality directly into swarm-mail, eliminating the separate MCP server and duplicate PGLite instance.

### What We're Removing (Accidental Complexity)
- Separate MCP server process
- Separate PGLite instance (duplicate memory usage)
- Cross-process IPC overhead
- Separate config/setup

### What We're Adding
- Memory tables in swarm-mail schema
- Ollama integration for embeddings
- Migration path for existing memories
- Unified search API

### Architecture After
```
swarm-mail (single PGLite)
├─ events table
├─ hive tables  
├─ agent_mail tables
└─ memories + embeddings ← NEW
```

### Success Criteria
1. `semantic-memory_*` tools work without separate MCP server
2. Existing memories migrated to swarm-mail PGLite
3. Single PGLite instance for all data
4. Graceful fallback when Ollama unavailable (FTS only)
5. `bun add opencode-swarm-plugin` includes memory functionality

### References
- Source: https://github.com/joelhooks/semantic-memory
- PGLite version: 0.3.14 (same as swarm-mail)
- Parent cell: mjbqs7xge52
